unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain News: Vendor Audit Intensification Expected Post-Diwali**
normalised: **Manufacturing and Supply Chain News: Vendor Audit Intensification Expected Post-Diwali**

unnormalised: Mumbai, Oct 26 – Manufacturing firms across India are gearing up for increased vendor audits following the Diwali festivities, experts predict. Concerns over quality control and supply chain resilience, exacerbated by recent global disruptions, are driving the trend.
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty six – Manufacturing firms across India are gearing up for increased vendor audits following the Diwali festivities, experts predict. Concerns over quality control and supply chain resilience, exacerbated by recent global disruptions, are driving the trend.

unnormalised: "Companies are tightening their focus on vendor compliance," stated Ms. Priya Sharma, supply chain consultant at Tata Strategic Management Group. "Post-Diwali, many firms will conduct thorough audits to ensure suppliers meet required standards."
normalised: "Companies are tightening their focus on vendor compliance," stated Miz Priya Sharma, supply chain consultant at Tata Strategic Management Group. "Post-Diwali, many firms will conduct thorough audits to ensure suppliers meet required standards."

unnormalised: The audits will primarily assess compliance with quality benchmarks (ISO 9001), ethical sourcing policies, and environmental regulations. Some companies are even integrating elements of surprise audits to ensure consistent performance.
normalised: The audits will primarily assess compliance with quality benchmarks (I S O nine thousand and one), ethical sourcing policies, and environmental regulations. Some companies are even integrating elements of surprise audits to ensure consistent performance.

unnormalised: This move comes after several instances of substandard materials impacting production schedules. The focus is not solely on large vendors; even smaller suppliers, critical for niche components like those used in textile manufacturing in Surat, are under scrutiny. Many firms are scheduling these to be completed before year-end, with reports expecting increased scrutiny to continue post-Onam and into Q1 2024. A bad batch of spices from a supplier – ruining several batches of biryani served in factory canteens – triggered one audit, insiders revealed. This increased vigilance aims to safeguard brand reputation and prevent future disruptions.
